title: 93/219/EEC: Commission Decision of 23 March 1993 authorizing the Federal Republic of Germany to permit temporarily the marketing of bitter white lupin seed not satisfying the requirements of Council Directive 66/401/EEC
header:
COMMISSION DECISION of 23 March 1993 authorizing the Federal Republic of Germany to permit temporarily the marketing of bitter white lupin seed not satisfying the requirements of Council Directive 66/401/EEC
(93/219/EEC)THE COMMISSION OF  THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: The Federal Republic of Germany is authorized to permit, for a period expiring on 31 October 1993, the marketing in its territory of a maximum of 400 tonnes of commercial seed of bitter white lupin (Lupinus albus L.). The official lable shall  stated: 'Intended exclusively for Germany'.

The other Member States are hereby authorized to permit, subject to the conditions laid down in Article 1, the marketing in their territory of a total amount of 400 tonnes of commercial seed of bitter white lupin (Lupinus albus L.) provided  that it is intended exclusively for the Federal Republic of Germany. The official label shall state: 'Intended exclusively for Germany'.

Member States shall notify the Commission before 31 December 1993 of the quantities of seed marketed in their territory pursuant to his Decision. The Commission shall inform the other Member States thereof.
This Decision is addressed to the Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 23 March 1993.
For the Commission
RenĂŠ STEICHEN
Member of the Commission
(1) OJ No 125, 11. 7. 1966, p. 2298/66.
(2) OJ No L 104, 22. 4. 1992, p. 61.
(3) OJ No L 93, 8. 4. 1986, p. 21.
(4) OJ No L 203, 26. 7. 1991, p. 108.
